TopicTitle: If there were no limits - what would you make?

Articles.Content:
General Service Vehicles, with their complements of smaller ships.

Edit: Or maybe a Niven-style Ringworld.

Also, add another one to my list: Ability to never run out of RAM.

well, I can't prove that we are not.

I'm pretty sure I saw horse that someone made a while back. 

- A suspension bridge over Des Canyon (constructed in situ, not just landed over it).

- A highly detailed replica of Serenity with full interior and working shuttles (and main engines that don't flop about).

- Mass-relay type rail-cannons and then do a grand tour that involved flinging a Kerbal between planets. (I've tried to build a KSP rail gun before, it mostly exploded).

- A stable rover ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Let me see... A space elevator, a parkour city, an aircraft carrier, a stock supersized hover carrier, a replica of the bebop from Bebop, a replica cube station from Elite: Dangerous, and a domino course the size of gilly (not really but someone would).

Seriously though, I would probably do a realistic long term colony mission to Laythe. Balancing for radiation shielding and full sized rockets to return from the surface. It would be like Avatar (blue people movie) in a nutshell. I would also make an entire video series based on it.
A [Bistromathic Drive](http://hitchhikers.wikia.com/wiki/Bistromatics) powered ship.
